{{nihongo|'''Makoto Hasebe'''|é·è°·é¨ èª |Hasebe Makoto|extra=born 18 January 1984 in [[Fujieda, Shizuoka|Fujieda]], [[Shizuoka Prefecture|Shizuoka]], [[Japan]]}} is a [[Japanese people|Japanese]] [[Association football|football]] player. He is a right-footed midfielder who currently plays for [[VfL Wolfsburg]] and is currently the captain of the [[Japan national football team]] in the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]].
==Club career== ===Urawa Red Diamonds (2002â2007)=== After graduating from Fujieda Higashi High School in 2002, he joined [[Urawa Red Diamonds]]. He became a regular of their first team in the 2003 season. In 2004, he was honoured with the [[J. League Cup]] New Hero Award and selected as a member of J. League team of the year. He was also the Urawa Fans' Player of the Year that season.
It was reported in October 2007 that Italian [[Serie A]] side [[A.C. Siena]] was keen to sign Hasebe the following January.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://search.japantimes.co.jp/cgi-bin/sc20071021a2.html |title=Siena wants Reds' Hasebe: report | publisher = The Japan Times Online | date = 21 October 2007 | accessdate = 14 June 2010}}</ref>
===Wolfsburg (2008â)=== [[File:Flickr - tpower1978 - 1.Bundesliga.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Wolfsburg 2008-2009]] However, he signed for [[FuÃball-Bundesliga|Bundesliga]] side Wolfsburg becoming the first Japanese player ever to play for the Wolves.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.vfl-wolfsburg.de/52383+M5a0b9b58985.html |title = Wolves sign Japanese midfielder | publisher= vflwolfsburg.de | date= 20 January 2008 | accessdate = 14 June 2010}}</ref> In 2009, he became the second Japanese player to win the [[FuÃball-Bundesliga|Bundesliga]] title after [[Yasuhiko Okudera]].
On 29 April 2010, it was announced that Hasebe extended his contract with Wolfsburg until 2012.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://sports.yahoo.com/soccer/news?slug=ap-wolfsburg-hasebe | title = Hasebe extends contract with Wolfsburg | publisher = Sports.yahoo.com |date = 29 April 2010| accessdate = 14 June 2010}}</ref>
On 17 September 2011, Hasebe played in goal for the final nine minutes of an away match against [[TSG 1899 Hoffenheim]]. Wolfsburg lost the match 3â1, with Hasebe conceding Hoffenheim's third goal on 85 minutes.
==International career== [[File:Flickr - tpower1978 - International friendly match (1).jpg|thumb|right|Makoto Hasebe in the game against [[Ghana national football team|Ghana]] in [[Switzerland]] in 2009]] Hasebe made his senior national team debut on February 11, 2006, in a friendly match against the [[United States men's national soccer team|USA]] at [[AT&T Park]] in [[San Francisco]].
He was the onfield captain in the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]], as [[Yoshikatsu Kawaguchi]] was the reserve third string goalkeeper, and was captain in the [[2011 AFC Asian Cup]].
